name: Sackcloth
description: A burlap sack worn underneath the clothes. Itchy, but better than nothing.

name: Hide
description: Dried animal skins roughly sewn into a protective vest. Thick and sturdy.

name: Chieftain's Tunic
description: This brilliantly colored nomad tunic is crafted from heavy wool and ornamented with ornate embroidery. The hem of the garment depicts the continuously winding roots of the World Tree.

name: Heavy Wool Tunic
description: A long, thick tunic fashioned from the prized wool of nomadic herdsmen.

name: Tiger Skin Vest
description: Quaid fire motifs on the tooled leather belt are the only hint at the origins of this exotic garment.

name: Fur
description: Valuable animal furs fashioned into a warm and well padded vest.

name: Leather
description: Cured leather carefully sewn into a well fashioned jerkin.

name: Warrior Monk's Habit
description: This heavily padded monk's habit is adorned with the symbols of the 9th Branch of the Selini, House Militant, Defenders of Truth and Order.

name: Wool Gambeson
description: Several layers of fine wool, painstakingly quilted together and stuffed with scrap cloth and animal hair to form a sturdy defense against all but the most devastating blows.

name: Assassin's Folly
description: At first glance this appears to be no more than an ornate nobleman's shirt. Closer inspection reveals row upon row of light metal plates sewn to the inside of the garment. A gash at the small of the back indicates that it's ingenious design foiled at least one assassin.

name: Silk Gambeson
description: Layer upon layer of durable silk quilted together with horse hair padding to create an armor capable of stopping an arrow with no injury to the wearer.

name: Master of Archers
description: This Ash gambeson is crafted from the finest silk and features intricate embroidery identifying its owner as the 'King's Master of Archers'. Dozens of minor repairs over the surface indicate that this unparalleled armor has seen many conflicts, most likely passed from one Master to the next upon retirement.

name: The Platinum Fleece
description: Much more valuable than a mere 'golden' one. Stripped from the corpse of the  Axxima Vatta Muttunaxxor itself, this blindingly brilliant fleece knows no equal.

name: Jack of Chains
description: A light gambeson with several crudely forged metal links attached to the outside of the arms for added protection.

name: Maille Shirt
description: A shirt made from hundreds of interlinking metal rings, each one riveted shut to prevent rupture.

name: Glory of War
description: This exquisite Quaid armor luxuriates in style.  Each ring of maille is blued, and the last rows of the shirt are gilded to create a golden border.  The reinforcing plates are ornamented with gilded patterns and prominently display the symbol of the Imperial family.  Scratched into the surface of the metal are the Quaid words <LQ>how late it is to think on these things<RQ>.  Several more words are scratched around the corners of the plates, but the haste in which they appear to have been written has rendered them illegible.

name: Mixed Maille
description: A maille shirt with metal plates linked directly into the rings for extra torso protection.  Standard issue for Quaid infantry during the war.

name: Horseman's Lamellar
description: This well-fashioned lamellar harness features extended shoulder protection and knee length tassets, indicating that the harness was designed for heavy cavalry.  The gilded vambraces and silk gambeson reveal the previous owner to have been a warrior of wealth and taste.  Several of the plates are etched with a small foreign script that does not appear to be any regional language.  The location of these plates over the wearer's heart may mean that the script is some kind of protective prayer or charm, but this is pure conjecture.

name: Lamellar
description: Dozens of small metal plates laced together with durable silk cord.

name: Traitor's Harness
description: The gilded spaulders on this Ash-made coat of plates indicate that it most likely belonged to a high ranking official.  The canvas surface has been repaired, but the Ash word <LQ>traitor<RQ> can still be seen carved into the cloth.  Extensive bloodstains are visible through the red dye, though no discernible damage has been done to the armor.

name: Coat of Plates
description: Excellent torso protection made by riveting several large heavy metal plates to the inside of a durable canvas surcoat.

name: Strength of Wocolan
description: This green velvet brigandine features large, brightly polished spaulders typical of Quaid heavy infantry.  The gilded crest depicts the Quaid hero Wocolan crushing a bear's head with his hands.  Below, his children Wastan and Wacella drink the blood running from the bear's mouth in order to survive the family's grueling march into exile.

name: Brigandine
description: Hundreds of metal plates riveted to the inside of a canvas and silk-velvet shell to create a form fitting torso protection.

name: Lord Warden's Harness
description: Insignia identify the owner of this excellent plate harness as the Lord Warden, the Ash official assigned to oversee the Pit.  How he came to be lost inside his own prison is unknown, but blood stains on the shoulder straps indicate that the story did not end well.

name: Plate Harness
description: Complexly shaped steel plates articulated on a leather base to create maximum protection while preserving range of motion.  The preferred gear of Ash Knights.

name: Purity of Flame
description: This brilliantly polished plate harness reflects any light with an almost inferno-like intensity.  Faint etchings appear to be Quaid, but the dialect is so archaic as to be unreadable save for the phrase <LQ>that which consumes<RQ>.  This breastplate has most likely been refurbished countless times - the rest of the harness is far more modern.  Cryptic pictograms hint at some possible role in the Imperial Fire Ritual.

name: Guardian of the Fountain
description: This masterfully crafted plate harness has been blued to almost blackness.  Gilded patterns across the surface of the breastplate depict the Ash Temple Fountain, indicating that this amazing armor most likely belonged to one of the elite Temple Guards.  How such a priceless artifact came to be in the Pit is a mystery.

name: Stone Skull
description: A polished stone skull.  Some suggest it is a magic talisman carried into battle by the revenant.<N><N><N>Experts agree that you could probably trade this for something really cool.

name: Bronze Skull
description: Cast of solid bronze, perhaps used for special incantations and ceremonies.<N>Certainly more valuable than a polished stone skull.

name: Obsidian Skull
description: Meticulously carved out of solid obsidian, the detail in this deep black skull is both<N>magnificent and haunting. Extremely rare, this type of skull is highly sought-after by collectors.

name: Silver Skull
description: This skull is made of pure silver. What could it be for?

name: Gold Skull
description: This skull is made of pure gold. What could it be for?

name: Unobtanium Skull
description: Made of pure unobtanium, and therefore impossible to obtain. You've actually been carrying it with you this whole time but, mysteriously, just haven't noticed it until now.

name: Stone shiv
description: A sharp rock affixed to a wood handle. Better than nothing.

name: Metal shiv
description: A blade of scrap metal. Crude, but effective.

name: Rusty sword
description: A rusty, beaten-up sword. The Pit is littered with such cast-off relics of the war.

name: Blood-Feud Kopal
description: This nomad fighting knife is engraved with the symbols of the Gasta tribe above the symbol of an unknown rival group - indicating a blood-feud between the two.  Its bone handle is grooved with 17 death notches.

name: Iron sword
description: A simple iron sword. It's poorly balanced and crudely forged, but otherwise in good condition.

name: Honor's Vindication
description: The ornate jade hilt and pommel inlays belie the wicked functionality of this Quaid dueling sword.  The base of the blade bears the inscription,<N><LQ>Vindication of the Honorable.  The Flame Within Me Burns.<RQ>  It was most likely created for a specific duel, settling an alleged dishonor between two nobles.

name: Soldier's sword
description: A military sword, mass-produced during the war. It's effective and strong.

name: Edge of Order
description: This Ash-made cutter bears an archaic inscription running the length of the blade's spine:<N><LQ>I am the edge of order.  I divide the righteous from the evil, the darkness from the light.  I guide the hand that wields me to d...<RQ> Generations of polishing render the rest of the text too faint to make out.

name: Officer's sword
description: Another remnant of the war, this one was hand-crafted for an officer.

name: Commander of Legions
description: The elegant yet simple construction of this Ash weapon indicates that it was created for a modest noble.<N><N>One side of the hilt bears the inscription 'Commander of Legions' while the reverse reads 'Servant of the Unmoved Mover.' The disc pommel is engraved on one side with the spheres of the celestial machine and on the other with a pilgrim drinking from the Ash Temple Fountain.

name: Master's sword
description: Expertly balanced and tempered, this sword is the work of a master craftsman.

name: Eye of the Flame
description: This faultless sword bears an ancient Quaid inscription running down the fuller.  The extreme age of the dialect and wear to the blade have made it all but indecipherable:<N><LQ>Behold...Eye of the Flame...Glory...Flee shameful...A Kingly Thing...<RQ>  Two enourmous rubies on the pommel seem to burn with an internal fire.  The expertly cast hilt shows the Wall of Remembrance - where the names of all honorable Quaid Emperors are marked down.  This remarkable weapon most likely belonged to a member of the Royal line.

name: Evni
description: A berserker's dream sword.  There's only one in the world, and the price seems to have been set accordingly.

name: Item+
description: A mysterious + symbol marks it as much stronger than normal.

name: Green bow
description: A simple bow made from sapling wood and stocked with wooden arrows.

name: Wood bow
description: A bow made from wood and stocked with stone-tipped arrows.

name: Hunter Warrior
description: This nomad hunting bow appears to have doubled as a weapon of war.  The Nomad symbol for 'good hunting' has been painted over with the symbol for 'death'. On the inside of the bow is a depiction of a Sdeka family god, holding a severed head.  Red victory stripes at the tips indicate that this weapon was put to much use in some conflict long forgotten.

name: Hunter's bow
description: A strong bow made from yew and stocked with stone-tipped arrows.

name: Relic of the North
description: This fine hunting bow is crafted from pure white birchwood.  The blue leather grip is wound with gold wire, and a strange script winds around the ends - possibly one of the many languages of the Northern city states.   The nomad symbol of the Ked family is painted on one side, indicating that the weapon traveled South with that tribe.

name: Antler bow
description: A powerful bow carved from a hart's antler.

name: Captain's Warbow
description: This Ashani warbow is composed of several layers of rare woods glued together.  The grip has a depiction of a turning gear and a gold inscription. It reads, Captain Zantimon, defender of the way, most likely a leader of one of the numerous patrols that used to safeguard Ash Temple pilgrims against bandits and Nomad raiders.

name: Great stag bow
description: An ancient bow carved from a great stag's antler.

name: Warlord's Triumph
description: This expertly crafted recurve bow is adorned with gold ringlets and brightly colored leather.  The tooled grip depicts a victorious warlord standing on a mountain of slain enemies.  Several unrecognizable dieties bless him from above.  This weapon obviously belonged to a wealthy and successful Nomad Chieftan.

name: Composite warbow
description: This composite bow, formed from several different woods, likely belonged to a officer.

name: Gilded Death
description: This horn-tipped warbow is ornamented with numerous golden rings.  The leather grip carries an archaic Quaid inscription: <LQ>Lucawan, you who have murdered honor for tawdry gold, in the gold of this weapon see your death. Its dart shall find you, and your traitorous corpse shall be the plaything of dogs and worms.<RQ>  Below, scratched into the surface of the leather are the words <LQ>it has been done.<RQ>

name: Reinforced longbow
description: Composed of thick oak, this bow takes incredible strength to draw, but is able to deliver lethal strikes for those who can handle it.

name: Charlatan's Staff
description: This ornately carved staff is adorned with a strange text running along the shaft. Closer inspection reveals that this script is no more than gibberish, carved to fool the illiterate. The ends of the staff contain several hollow compartments containing powders to produce colored smoke and what was presumably once a live canary.

name: Oaken staff
description: A finely carved oaken staff with a sturdy leather grip.

name: Archshepherd Stave
description: This sturdy staff is covered in charms written in multiple dialects of Quaid, Ash, Nomad and several unidentifiable languages.  Along the top of the staff are the Quaid words <LQ>Master of Sheep, Keeper of the Stores<RQ>.  The Jewel of the Desert crest appears below, indicating that the unfortunate owner was charged with administering the vicious feral sheep below the city.  The lower end of the staff is covered in hundreds of toothmarks, with several teeth still lodged in the surface of the wood.

name: Bludgeon
description: A sturdy oak staff with one end hollowed out and filled with lead for added weight.

name: The Beast's Weapon
description: This remarkable staff is carved from a single piece of ivory.  What monster could produce a horn of such size is a truly terrifying thought.  Ornate carvings down the length of the staff appear to tell the story of some unknown hero.  It matches no Ash, Nomad or Quaid motifs, and there are no identifying words, leaving both the identity of the carver and the monster from which the horn originally came a mystery.

name: Ironwood staff
description: An excellent staff carved from the rarest of woods.

name: Executioner's Bludgeon
description: This hefty staff is shod with iron and one end has been hollowed out and filled with lead to provide added momentum to its swing.  Strange etchings adorn the surface of the metal.  The language is unknown, most likely one of the many tongues spoken in the Northern city states.  Crossed keys underneath a death's head most likely symbolize some position of authority, possibly a jailor, executioner or some other office seen as unworthy of using a sword.  Blood stains on the staff's striking end indicate that this authority was frequently exercised.

name: Steel-Shod Staff
description: A sturdy staff that has been reinforced with long steel plates.

name: Keeper of the Flame
description: This silver-plated staff is tarnished with generations of handling. Less sullied areas appear to be covered with archaic Quaid writing. The darkening of the silver and the extreme age of the dialect render most of it indecipherable. The phrase <LQ>those who hold the flame<RQ> appears several times, as does, <LQ>ecstasy... consume<RQ>. Both ends of the staff are almost black with accumulated scorch marks, hinting at possible use in the Quaid Imperial fire ritual.

name: Pilgrim's Staff
description: One of the many staffs given out to travelers by the Selini monks.  The shaft is reinforced with steel plates and the surface of the wood has been carved with prayers.

name: Kozomon's Scepter
description: This rustic oak staff bears the inscription <LQ>Kozomon Kastankim<RQ> in an incredibly archaic Ash dialect, labeling this simple implement as the property of Selinadt's first disciple.  This relic was believed to have been lost when its chapter house was looted in the last years of the Quaidian war.  The gold and jewels that used to adorn it have been stripped away long ago, but the staff itself remains undamaged.  Centuries of veneration and several fires have darkened the original wood to almost pitch blackness, though it retains all of its strength.

name: <NOTHING>
description: Perhaps you should take this book with you on your next adventure.

name: Shock Lightning
description: Lightning shocks enemies, paralyzing them briefly.

name: Chain Lightning
description: Lightning strikes 1 additional target with diminishing power for each skill point in Lightning.

name: Light of Judgment
description: Casting Heal also applies BLIND to all enemies.

name: Light of Glory
description: Casting Heal also applies LIGHT to all enemies.

name: Slow Start
description: Newly spawned enemies are slowed temporarily.

name: Slow End
description: Enemies within slow down as they approach $MCG.

name: Crystal patch
description: $MCG begins the level surrounded by several crystals.

name: Psi Shield
description: Enemies that hit $MCG deduct Psi instead of HP. Less Psi is lost for every point spent on the Crystal spell.

name: Explosive Start
description: Summoning and boosting defenders causes a small explosion.

name: Explosive End
description: A small explosion goes off when a defender is defeated.

name: Book of Plagues
description: All defenders except $MCG can't regenerate, and all enemies except bosses are permanently toxic.<N><N><RE>[$ITM_BOOK_PERHAPS_DESCRIPTION]

name: Book of Blood
description: All defenders and enemies, except $MCG and bosses, are permanently bleeding.<N><N><RE>[$ITM_BOOK_PERHAPS_DESCRIPTION]

name: Book of Synergy
description: Ice, water, and fire no longer cancel.<N><N><RE>[$ITM_BOOK_PERHAPS_DESCRIPTION]

name: Valley of the Forgotten
description: This book has no magical powers, but is instead an autobiography. It tells the story of a young Ashani librarian who survives an epidemic only to find herself trapped in a plague colony.  It is written in the form of a journal, with many illustrations drawn with improvised materials such as charcoal, tea, plant extracts, and blood.<N><N><RE>[$ITM_BOOK_PERHAPS_DESCRIPTION]

name: Book of Daring
description: Defenders cannot be re-summoned once defeated or recalled in battle.

name: Book of Face
description: ONLY works on EXTREME challenges: <N><N>Enemies will randomly update their <LQ>status<RQ> with new faces. Quite strange.

name: Anonymous Book
description: ONLY works on EXTREME challenges: <N><N>Defenders become anonymous, and gain +3% chance to dodge.

name: Book of Secrets
description: You can hear a soft whispering when you hold it to your ear.<N><N><RE>[$ITM_BOOK_PERHAPS_DESCRIPTION]
